oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Spring Frog
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Portrait of Cherokee tribal leader Spring Frog in yellow tunic with blue fringe.

"Tooan Tuh," or Spring Frog, was a Cherokee chief born near Lookout Mountain in 1754. He was a skilled trapper, hunter, and ball player. He served under General Jackson during the campaign against the Creeks. He was an advocate for peace, migrating to Oklahoma in 1817-1818, before the Trail of Tears.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: McKenney, Thomas L. (Thomas Loraine), 1785-1859; Hall, James, 1793-1868
